revised_title: Formation and Characteristics of Superlattices in Iron and Aluminium Alloys
tldr: A study of iron and aluminium alloys reveals that they cannot be considered as simple solid solutions. Instead, they exhibit interesting features in lattice spacings and atomic distribution. A superlattice forms in certain ranges, with aluminium atoms segregating into definite positions. This study provides a detailed quantitative analysis of these lines and sheds light on the stages by which the superlattice is built up.
